intro: Hemibaccharis corymbosa, commonly known as flame bush, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and clusters of bright orange to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological value.
